title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and received and e-mail for a call with a recruiter less than a week. I thought call was fine - recruiter was informative and nice, but I was asked somewhat obvious, redundant questions like: 

-What is your clinical and non-clinical recruiting experience? (This question obviously did not bother me because its standard, but I was asked to elaborate on aforementioned non-clinical roles as if there was something novel about recruiting for regular corporate positions…)
-How many years have you worked remotely? (The whole recruiting team is remote but they make it sound like if you are new to WFH you may have challenges)

This was a Limited Tenure AKA Temp position, but comes with Full Benefits.  I thought target salary didnt match with what they were looking for. I thought my expectations matched my experience + Southern CA cost of living, but recruiter said theres folks who have been longer with the team making less. Thats off-putting  because 1) That doesnt mean much when overall work experience should be considered 2) Although FTE benefits are included it doesnt make up for the fact this is a *3 month position
 

*JD and recruiter didnt say exactly how long the tenure was except for the summer so assuming only 3 months only. Also there was no promise of conversion. What a red flag was is that they opened this position to cover FTEs who go on PTO, get sick, etc. That insinuates the current team cannot handle covering for their peers or recruiters are expected to constantly be working on reqs.

Recruiter said I would be scheduled for next round interviews, but I heard nothing back. I would honestly give a negative rating experience solely based that. I appreciate a generic negative rejection that I’m assuming they try to give their own candidates. 

My advice to other candidates: focus on your clinical experience. I responded to the “Whats the most difficult role you’ve recruited for?” with a technical related role. Just answer with a clinical/provider role. Also dont share salary expectations because I think they have many applicants and have to weed some out that say they are “flexible.”
Interview Questions: Whats the most difficult role youve recruited for?

Interview Descriptions: Applied for a position at night, got an email asking for my references the next morning. After references are completed, got a call for an interview. During COVID-19, you get your temperature checked and they give you a mask. Interview was nerve-wracking but the panel of 3 were welcoming and made it conversational. First half was questions about yourself, second half were scenario. Make sure you have questions to ask at the end! Overall the interview and advice from the panel made me more motivated to get the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Patient Relations/Cosmetic Surgery Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Online, confusing, impersonal, and completely uncomfortable. Wouldn't have hired me either. Also, wouldn't put anyone through that kind of desensitized process were I a conglomerate attempting to appear caring, humane, or benevolent.
Interview Questions: I can't remember, I was too busy trying to figure out how the process worked since I wasn't given any notice that this was not a live online interview, and my laptop system, was having trouble with displaying the information.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty easy going interview, but they do make you study their rules of conduct prior to the interview so that they can test you. As long as you be yourself, you should be fine!
Interview Questions: What are the five pillars of the company?

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied in December, interview by January. Admin assist emailed me for interview. Had interview with Panel of 5 head nurses. Had word a week later. Hiring manager kept in good contact with me the entire time.
Interview Questions: who is your role model and why

title: Diet Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: After applying you are contacted by the hiring manager and given a description of the job and asked if you are still interested. An in person interview is then set up. After the interview, if moved forward you will be contacted again by the hiring manager and asked to submit 3 references (2 of which have to be a lead/manager/supervisor). Once your references are completed you will receive contact from the hiring manager if you got the position or not. Once that verbal offer has been made, you will receive emails of paperwork to accept the written offer.
Interview Questions:
They ask you sections of questions. Each section has about 4-8 questions in it.

 The first are general questions like: "Tell me why you would be a good fit for this position / why you want this position" or "Tell me about your education". 

The second are situational based questions like: "Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient/client" or "Name a time you had to make an important decision on your own because your supervisor was unable to be contacted". 

The third types of questions are factual and require basic knowledge of nutrition. Some questions are about food allergies, specific special diets, DM diets, etc.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, about a week later received a phone call to schedule and in person interview. During the interview I was asked the basic questions from why do you want to work here to tell me about a time where... or how would you handle a certain situation. About 3-4 days later I received a phone call an accepted the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Medical Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with supervisor only and took 30 min.  Very direct and seemed honest.  Questions made you think,  Dennis was respectful and seemed like a great supervisor to work for.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to deal with a tough customer.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: First telephone screening then two rounds of in-person interviews with different executives, board members and other admin assistants. Each interviewer asked a question and then they asked if I had any questions.
Interview Questions: What is your process for telling people “no?”

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Wasn’t much of an interview manager talk for 2 hrs straight about benefits of working here to convince me to leave Kaiser Permanente.  Pay is low starting at $23. Benefits not as competitive. Hiring process is long and require phone screen, manager interview and then a peer interview. Explain to her I can’t continue to call off work, and she said she had a good “feeling about this” and sent me an email two days later saying they moved on with different candidate. Waste of time.
Interview Questions: How long have you been an LVN?

title: Quality Assurance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: They were late, unorganized, and asked me several times if i was willing to work overtime as a salaried employee. They talked about how they work such long hours their eyes hurt.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work over time?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Contacted me over the phone to schedule in person interview. It was a two person panel. Took turns asking personality as well as basic nursing knowledge questions. At the end asked if I had any questions.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a conflict with a coworker and how did you respond?

title: Consultant, Business Process/Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fun, but I did not get the job. I was told I would hear back in two weeks and didn't hear back until two months later. It felt like I was dragged along without any closure.
Interview Questions: Why are you the right person for this job.

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were all very conversational and based both on personality and skill. I had plenty of opportunities to ask questions about the organization and figure out if it was right for me.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation that you needed to adjust a plan to a changing situation and how did it work out?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I applied to be a volunteer online through the Sharp Healthcare website. Later, I was notified to attend an informational presentation on the Sharp system, volunteering, and teamwork. During this event, I signed up for an interview slot. Two weeks later, I came in for an interview.
**STUDY THE POWERPOINT THEY PRESENT. MANY QUESTIONS ARE ASKED BASED ON THIS POWERPOINT**
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer for Sharp?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was so nervous because I was in front of 12 interviewers. I was asked one question after another. And i didn't feel welcomed at all. It was a horrible experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Fairly quick I think it was only a week or 2, asked why I wanted to volunteer and general info about what I'm interested in / studying and who I was.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (Del Mar, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I sat with a Manager & was totally completely informed about the job and the company and how the dept I interviewed works. What a training schedule would look like and whim would be training me.I was asked if I had any questions regarding the job I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: What does my current job work day involve

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Standard type of interview. Panel interview with the manager, a lead/charge nurse, and the nurse educator/Clinical Nurse Specialist. They asked about background and similar basic information and then gave information about the floor.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to this team?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took a few months from the submission of my application to the job offer. The interview was a panel interview with managers, clinical nurse specialists, and leads from several different departments. The questions were very standard interview questions. I used common interview questions from google to prepare. They were mostly interested in situational / personality type questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had a conflict with a coworker. Teach us about (x) medication before administering it

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview with 7 interviewers total. The interview was not very conversational but more in a question-then-answer format. They used more behavioral type questions because this was a new graduate RN interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you resolved conflict with a patient or family member.

title: Janitor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: One on one with person who asked me questions that I tried to answer to the best of my ability although they were quite easy, in fact so easy that I could have answered them
Interview Questions: Where do you want to be in 5 years

title: MDM Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted on LinkedIn from one of the Vendor Recruiter at Modis. Initial interview was with Vendor recruiter, just to get to know my details and comfortableness on the position. Then one phone interview and next Skype video interview with the crew.
Interview Questions: Moderate questions (technical and behavioral)

title: Strategic Sourcing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions:
First phone interview with internal recruiter who asked me three questions and ended the call before I had a chance to ask any questions. 

Second phone interview with the hiring manager who had me elaborate on my resume and asked me a few questions. He also did not ask me if I had any questions, but did give me the opportunity to ask questions once I insisted at the end of our call. 

Third interview onsite and I was given little information (I even had to ask for the address) and I showed up a little blindsided to a four-person panel interview. They were aware I drove about an hour to get there and I wasn’t offered a restroom break or a drink of water. I felt the interview went well. They told me they planned to make a decision within two weeks. I sent a follow-up “thank you” email to the hiring manager and never heard back. After all my time, a simple ‘thanks but we decided to pursue other candidates’ response would have been nice. 

Overall, I felt the experience was very one-sided and inconsiderate, which is a red flag to me, therefore I am not disappointed in not receiving an offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you overcame it.

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (La Mesa, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with the social work lead and two other employees in the department. Waited in the main lobby and the lead social worker came down to get me, then took me over to a room to interview with the three of them. Took about 25 minutes start to finish.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a conflict you had and how you handled it

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone call with recruiter, 2nd phone interview with Director, 3rd in-person group interview. First call was a general screening process, however they wanted to skip this step with me. During the interview time they also checked my LinkedIn profile.
Interview Questions: Previous experience and how it relates to this position?

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I started the interview process over the phone with the hiring manager and ended the process with an in-person interview with both the hiring manager and a panel of my prospective peers. Both were solid discussions. The phone interview lasted nearly an hour and a half.
Interview Questions: Time Management, give an example of a past difficulty with another employee and how did I handle it, what kind of experience I had with certain systems and applications that were listed as required skills for the job listing - usual.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare

For high school volunteers, they like commitment for 2 years. They do not want someone who graduates within a year.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of when you used your strengths as a leader.

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The questions were standardized at all interviews. The response after interviews was varied, with some positions not responding at all, while others responded in a timely manner. Overall good experience.
Interview Questions: Standard what would you do in this situation questions.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 4, they all took turns to ask the questions, the people was intimidating, very professional and polite it took about 30 minutes they ask scenario question and personal questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare in Mar 2018

Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Patient Attendant Interview

My interview was around 30 minutes long and i was offered a position. I was told that a drug screen and background check would be conducted as long as a reference check. After that around three weeks later i  received an email to schedule my physical and drug test. Soon after i received an email stating that i was cleared and i was sent an appointment day for New Hire Paperwork. After that i was sent an orientation day and time.

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2018

Interview Questions:
As a NA, how do you manage the care of all 20 patients?
What are your strengths?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It is a lengthy process to fill out online but once it is done you can apply for several positions. When you obtain an interview they are Right on time and the woman who interviewed me explained the "Sharp Experience"
Interview Questions: I was asked about the Sharp Experience. I was asked about my experience in healthcare.

title: Clerical Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (Chula Vista, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great and management made it go a lot better with a welcoming and positive attitude. When I asked about growth, management was happy to hear about potential growth and even offered flexibility.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare in Jan 2018

Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Why would you be a good candidate for this role?

title: Staff RN Interview

Interview Questions: Tell me about your self. Excel test on pivots, vlookups and sum if function. Most of the questions  were from an HR form of  behavioral questions.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted over the phone about a week after submitting online application. Scheduled panel Interview with three admin employees.  Interview was about 30 minutes long. Asked about background with some behavior interview questions
Interview Questions: Describe a time you made a mistake and how you handled it

title: Referral Coordinaor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2017

They were very honest that they chose me to be interviewed first because of my previous experience with handling referrals.
Interview Questions: Are you experienced in handling a fast paced work environment while staying calm under pressure?

title: Staff RN Interview

Interview Questions: What does excellent patient care means for you?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview

Interview Questions: If an angry patients ex husband is yelling at you demanding to know where his wife is, what do you tell him?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer is nice. You won't really feel intimidated. The questions were mostly situational but they're not out of this world questions. The process took weeks, almost a month just to get an interview.
Interview Questions: You see patient lying on the floor and not breathing, what will you do?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (La Mesa, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to write an essay of why I wanted to become a volunteer and soon thereafter was called up for an interview. The lady was nice and promised that she was not as intimidating as most people thought of her. After I started talking about myself, I felt more confident when answering her questions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I completed an interview online. Within 2 weeks had an interview with two of the managers. Interview was standard asking about the pillars of excellence and examples of how I handled certain situations. They were very honest about what they were looking for in an employee and professional.
Interview Questions: Give an example of when you  encountered a discrepancy with a coworker or facility member? What did you do and what was the outcome?

title: UR/UM Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (La Mesa, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Called for an in-person interview. Then a second round. I was offered the job immediately following the second round. The manager was open and honest about all aspects of the process and the job.  I met with the whole staff. I had a tour of the facility. Everyone was welcoming and kind.
Interview Questions: Background , education, attitudes about work and my work/life balance.

title: Information Systems Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online - their system was totally replaced in the last year so I had to rebuild my entire profile and re-enter my employment history. 
Almost 3 months later I finally received a call from someone to set up an interview. In the time since I got hired for another position with another employer. In my experience an employee with a valuable skill set can obtain a job within a few weeks of initially looking. Not sure why they would wait so very long.
Interview Questions: When would you be available for an in person interview?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: It is really good but takes a while. Just know that the process does take a while but they will tell you by phone call if they hire you or not. Unlike other hospitals that don't do that at all.
Interview Questions: Just be prepapred for the interview

title: Clerical Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: First interview with 2 managers, then called the next day for second interview on a Friday.  Reference check started on Monday. Reference check is done by email.  5 references and they need to complete a long survey
Interview Questions: Greatest weakness

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview of 4. They seemed to be very organized in their hiring process. After my interview they answered any and all questions I had. They were very friendly and seemed like they genuinely cared, which felt nice. I would like to receive an offer from this organization.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a conflict with another nurse/nursing assistant? How did you handle it?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I had a peer interview - a bit relaxed and almost even unprofessional.  I prepped and stressed, but it was pretty unnecessary.  Half way through the interview, the topic changed to what I would be doing in detail, so it was pretty obvious that I was going to get hired at that point.
Interview Questions: You have a pt who is about to fall out of bed and a pt who is ripping their IV out, what do you do?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I cannot describe the interview in detail at this time. I felt the interviewing process was fair. I have spoken to many others that have gone through this and they feel that the interviews are pretty straightforward and typical for a direct care RN.
Interview Questions: handling a difficult situation.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was smooth and easy thanks to the staff for providing all documentation needed as well as keeping an open and constant communication with me. Justina is amazing and made my hiring process the BEST thus far.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years

title: Staff RN - ER Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: Came in for 3 different interview panels only to get a no because I lacked experience in the ER. Why did you drag me here three times if you knew you weren't going to hire me?
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current employer?

title: Data Governance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple. The hiring manager was very knowledgeable in the field and provided with a lot of information. The hiring manager did most of the talking, which made me a little nervous because I didn't want to interrupt.
Interview Questions: I don't remember being asked any questions other than if I had any questions regarding the position. I was asked why I chose my current school and what I wanted to do with my degree.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a request for phone screen a few days later. I found the recruiter to be very professional. She asked challenging questions that demonstrated that she understood the role and the type of person who would be a good fit. Despite my being very interested in the position and wanting to explore it further, I could tell from the recruiter's subtle verbal cues that I wasn't likely one of her favorite candidates. Nonetheless, she promised to get back to me within 2 weeks with next steps and/or an update. That didn't happen so I sent a quick follow-up email after 3-4 weeks. A few days later I received an auto-email letting me know that I was not being considered.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your leadership style?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 4 nurse managers and nurse educators, as well as the director of the new grad RN program. They were very friendly and seemed to genuinely want to get to know my personality and interest in nursing. They asked a lot of behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a conflict you've had with a colleague, and how did you deal with it?

title: Device Deployment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: They conducted a phone interview and a panel interview. Both interviews were fairly simple and asked straight forward IT terms. For the phone interview, it was approximately 30 minutes long. The panel interview did not take more then an hour. As long as you know basic IT terms, you should be fine. If you would like to refresh your memory, I would just go over the CompTIA A+ certification.
Interview Questions: What is a MAC address? What is an image when it comes to new installation? Similar definitions

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen interview with HR followed by phone interview with hiring manager, in person interview with hiring manager before receiving an offer via email. It was normal expectation for this type of job.
Interview Questions: What is a challenge I experienced in my current job and how did I handle it

title: Associate Dean of Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with the Hiring Educator after applying online and receiving an email to set up interview. Met with her at the college and spent approximately 1 hour discussing resume and job description. Very informative, relaxed and comfortable to speak freely, very professional, Best interview I have ever had for a nursing position.
Interview Questions: Explain your overall teaching style.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview basic knowledge questions then invited to panel interview. Followed by panel interview consisting of four people where a great deal of customer service scenario were brought up. Then a  final panel interview with hiring manager and director. It was a formality but questions were still asked.
Interview Questions: Phone interview basic PC knowledge, Panel question knowledge of PC and Active Directory knowledge, lots of customer  service scenario questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, not to difficult, took every possible course to be the best candidate and volunteered before I was even considered. The people were nice and pleasant.......,.......,..................................................,.................................................................in the end it still feels as though it's who you know not what you know.
Interview Questions: How do you use critical thinking

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (Mira Mesa, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: After I submitted my resume, I received a call to set up an interview for the next day and was hired on the spot. I was then instructed to compete a physical, drug test and background check. I then started working within 3 days.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I was bilingual.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was referred to Sharp by a friend who talked to her manager. I was called about a week later. The are two interview one with the Director of the Site and then there is Panel interview with 4 of your future co-workers. The HR process can take a little of time but the whole process took about 3 months.

How do you work in team? 
Tell me about your previous experiences?
What are some of the things that you can work on your weaknesses?
Why did you have a gap in employment?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (La Mesa, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied at the end of October 2015 and a month later received an e-mail saying that they were interested in interviewing me. I replied to the e-mail right away and got an interview at the beginning of December. Interviewed with the unit manager and supervisor. The interview lasted for 30 minutes. They alternated questions.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work at Sharp? Give us an example where you stood up for your patient, etc.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got a call to interview. Interviewed a few days later and got an offer later that day. The staff were nice and friendly. The process went quick because they were looking to fill the position quickly. I would have started a week later had I accepted the offer. I turned it down due to it not being the unit placement I wanted and short notice for starting.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a patient in pain and the doctor will not order more pain meds for you? The patient is screaming and throwing things at you.

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: I was very unimpressed with the professionalism of the interviewers. They did not ask one question about me, but were trying to find out information about a previous hospital I had worked for. They had said that they would follow up with me whether or not I received the job, and I heard nothing, even with my own followup.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience with this previous hospital?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare
Interview Descriptions: I am typically part of a panel and am well aware of the interview process. I interviewed for a system analyst position. Had a positive phone interview with hiring manager. Was asked to go in an hour interview with a panel. Most of the questions were project oriented "how would you prioritize your work load and what would you do if you were tasked with project from your manager but had other responsibilities." I answered everything and I must say based on me having my own experience being on a panel I had good answers. However there was one senior analyst who kept going off topic( list of questions are provided to panel). Kept asking questions she came up with herself- more project oriented questions but expected a technical answer. Sure enough I get an email from the hiring manager saying they liked me interview but had more questions about my technical ability. Don't think panel members should come up with their own questions on the spot. Basically a waste of my time with the bias questions and fake personalities. Guess if your there for 8 years with the same title and no progression. Manager indicated not many bonuses but good environment. With the panel members- I doubt that.
Interview Questions: Senior panel member: what type of environment do you like to work under?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview Process was fairly quick; within 2 wks. Through an employee referral.  I was invited for a five person panel interview.  After the interview, I was asked to come back to meet with the doctors within a few days. That same day the manager contacted to offer position. It took 2 weeks because I provided the proper two week notice to my former boss.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Radiologic Technologist II Interview

At the interview, I was told that the entire hiring process would take a few weeks.  If I had been considered for the position, I would have received an offer, then they would have performed a full background check.

Tell me all about yourself.

Other Behavioral questions.

title: Systems Analyst Interview

title: Applicant Interview

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare

After some introductory general questions and trying to find out more about the position because the online job description was very vague, the interviewer told me I was too "technical" to be a systems analyst.  He basically wanted someone that was not technical which I'm not sure how effective you can be as good systems analyst without having technical knowledge.  Manager was very green and after the phone interview I withdrew my submission for the position.
Interview Questions: How would you go about adding a new field to a web form based on customer's requirements?

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Director of Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Sharp HealthCare (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen interview with the recruiter (via LinkedIn connection), followed by an in-person interview with hiring manager, then another in-person interview with hiring manager and his boss, and finally two panel interviews with peers and staff. Then Sharp conducted a background check, drug screen, and professional reference checks with my most recent supervisor, peer, and employee. Finally, they conducted a full physical exam, wrapping up this very thorough pre-employment process. The entire process took 11 weeks from initial phone screen to first day on the job. I had to order a replacement copy of my Social Security card because they require a physical card at orientation. All in all, my interview "experience" at Sharp was very positive throughout!
Interview Questions: Describe your typical process used for strategic sourcing in healthcare.
